news_items.content: Here's a rewritten version of the news in clear and concise language:
India's Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to visit Chennai as part of his diplomatic tour. The city will also host several high-profile events this week.
In sports news, the Indian cricket team has won its first Test match against South Africa in three days at the MAChale Stadium. The visitors were bowled out for 246 runs on Tuesday.

The Indian government has announced plans to construct a new sea bridge in Tamil Nadu called Pamban Bridge. The bridge is expected to be completed by the end of this year and will provide an alternative route for ships traveling between India and Southeast Asia.

In business news, SoftBank's CEO Masayoshi Son has expressed confidence that AI will become more widely used in the coming years. Son believes that AI could help companies solve complex problems and make better decisions.
The Indian government has also announced plans to relax certain laws related to artificial intelligence (AI). The move aims to encourage innovation and growth in the sector.

The stock market is expected to continue its upward trend this week, with investors hoping for better economic data. However, there are concerns about the impact of the US-China trade tensions on global markets.
In other news, Meta has released a new AI-powered robot that can prepare coffee drinks. The company claims that the robot will help reduce labor costs and improve customer experience.
The government has also announced plans to raise $600 million through an A.I.-driven business model. The funds will be used to develop new treatments for diseases using artificial intelligence.
The Indian stock market is expected to move cautiously this week, with traders waiting to see how the government's policy decisions will impact the economy.
